Generate Factors for \(q = 3\)

Gen3Factors.Rd

This function generates factors for a given parameter \(m\) where \(q = 3\). The factors are generated using elements of the Galois Field GF(m-1) and include the point at infinity. The function performs several checks to ensure the validity of the input and uses parallel processing to compute the factors.

Gen3Factors(m)

Arguments

m

An integer representing the parameter for the factors. It must be a multiple of 6, and \(m-1\) must be a prime number.

Value

A list of factors in the Galois Field GF(m-1), including the point at infinity. The result is unlisted and contains the generated factors.

Details

The function checks if \(m\) is a multiple of 6 and if \(m-1\) is a prime number. It then calculates the factors using elements of the Galois Field GF(m-1) and processes them using parallel computation with `future_map` to speed up the operation. The factors include all elements of the field and are calculated using the iterated function approach. The result is unlisted to return a simple list of factors.

Examples

# Generate factors for q = 3
factors <- Gen3Factors(12)
